text: Francisco Massiani (2 April 1944 â€“ 1 April 2019) was a Venezuelan writer and painter. His first novel, Piedra de mar, has been a bestseller since it first came out in 1968. The book is a coming-of-age story about a middle class teenager in Caracas. He published many short stories and poetry collections. In 2012, he won the National Prize for Literature. Massiani was born in Caracas.
